<br>

 

<p>We will run some mini peer code review! Bring small pieces of your code along and discuss it with others over pastries!<br>Any level and any programming language welcome!</p><p><strong>Possible resources to prepare your session’s hack:</strong></p><ul><li>
</li></ul>
<div>
<ul>
<li>Oxford code review network guidelines: <a href="https://github.com/OxfordCodeReviewNet/forum">https://github.com/OxfordCodeReviewNet/forum</a>
</li>
<li>Code Review Checklist for Scientific Code and Software: <a href="https://zenodo.org/records/8432946">https://zenodo.org/records/8432946</a>
</li>
</ul>
</div><p><strong>Sessions’ agenda:</strong></p><ul>
<li>Brief round of introductions and description of the problems you’ll be working on during that session</li>
<li>Formation of possible groups or tandems, if participants have tips to exchange on certain topics</li>
<li>Hack</li>
<li>Wrap-up: progress and next steps</li>
</ul>
<div></div><div>We will then have a break for August and resume our sessions on Monday Sept 30.</div><p>Learn more about the Hacky Hour initiative <a href="../../meetups/hackyhour/index.html" title="Hacky Hour">here</a>.</p><div class="g-clear"></div>
